greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number at distance n from nearest prime.
link: Michael S. Branicky, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..228 (terms 0..91 from _R. J. Mathar_)
maple: A051700 := proc(m) option remember ; if m <= 2 then op(m+1,[2,1,1]) ; else min(nextprime(m)-m,m-prevprime(m)) ; fi ; end:
A051652 := proc(n) local m ; if n = 0 then RETURN(2); else for m from 0 do if A051700(m) = n then RETURN(m) ; fi ; od: fi ; end:
for n from 0 to 79 do printf("%d %d\n",n,A051652(n)); od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 22 2009
mathematica: A051700[n_] := A051700[n] = Min[ NextPrime[n] - n, n - NextPrime[n, -1]]; a[n_] := For[m = 0, True, m++, If[A051700[m] == n, Return[m]]]; a[0] = 2; Table[ a[n], {n, 0, 40}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 19 2011, after _R. J. Mathar_ *)
program: return [2, 1, 1][n] if n < 3 else min(n-prevprime(n), nextprime(n)-n)
print([a(n) for n in range(26)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Feb 27 2021
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 07 1999
